text: Hello :slightly_smiling_face:  When we're creating pop up forms the image on the left is really too small and there's also no way of positioning it. Is there any way some customisation could be achieved? We tried 3rd party software but it seems to be a bit of a problem performance wise. Is it something that could eventually end up in <#C26E7JT8V|ideas> or is it just not possible for some reason? Thank you!

Hey Gabriela! This is a great idea! Would you be able to post this in our <https://ideas.HubSpot.com/|ideas community forum> and then post a link back to that idea in our <#C26E7JT8V|ideas> channel? This way other folks can upvote this idea as well.

hey there! I'm working on localhost to integrate <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/create_contact> to my companys website... basically im making a post request onSubmit (this is a Gatsby app - similar to React). I made an API key, and added it to the end of the url using environment variables but im getting a CORS error... is there a way I can test this out locally since I cant test this on our production website? thanks in advance!!

Hey <@U013L6H9QQJ> That API doesn’t accept requests made from the client side, that’s why you are seeing the CORS errors. You should use the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/submit_form|Form Submission API> instead. That will allow you to call it from the front-end. The contacts API requires your API keys (as you saw) and calling it from your static app would expose the key to any visitor of your site.

Hoping the community can help me figure out where to start digging to solve this problem:

Just got an SEO audit and looks like our blog isn't crawable. I have no clue why this might be. Is there some settings somewhere I am missing?
Looking for where to start digging

Hey Douglas, try checking in:
• Settings > Website > Pages > SEO & Crawlers tab and check the Robots.txt to see if there is a blocker.
• You can also check the template itself and see if there is <https://developers.google.com/search/reference/robots_meta_tag|any robots meta tags >
Those would be the first places to check
hrm, I thought I have checked these two things, but I will check again

hello terrance, i think you need see that attribute for that container, you need add a class and add that attr "min height" and overwrite that "min height" and thats all, you need be careful with another disposives (ipad and mobile) and adjunt with media that attr in the same class, i hope explain good, if not please answer me with your doubts and i answer you the most quickly i can
